projects.title: American Campus Communities
projects.description:
# American Campus Communities 25th Anniversary

This was a brochure page for the 25th anniversary of American Campus Communities. It was built with Vanilla JS. All of the animations and scroll effects were designed and developed specifically for this project.

> Vanilla JS
>
> Custom Animations
>
> Front-end Lead

projects.title: The Arthritis Foundation
projects.description:
# The Arthritis Foundation

This was a complete redesign and reimplementation of the Arthritis Foundation's public facing website. It was a long project that lead to the redesign and implementation of two other sub sites (Arthritis Connect Groups, and Arthritis LiveYes!). 

The home article pages were build as static pages using Vanilla JS for animations and interactions. The Search, Find a Doctor, and Article Listing pages are single page Vue.JS applications that get and post data to an API, displaying data managed in their CMS.

> Vanilla JS

> Vue.JS

> Custom Animations

> Front-end Lead

projects.title: American Society for Biochemistry & Molecular Biology
projects.description:
# American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Redesign and reimplementation of the ASBMB public facing website and member portal. I was the lead front-end developer on the project, but delegated tasks to other team mates who assisted.

> jQuery

> Vanilla JS

> Front-end Collaboration

projects.title: United Heritage Credit Union
projects.description:
# United Heritage Credit Union

Redesign and reimplementation of the UHCU website. This build included several complex Vanilla JS components (such as a loan calculator) as well as the integration of a few high priority Vue.JS Applications (a lead generator, and a dynamic form builder). 

UHCU was ambitious with their goals for this site, hoping to get a sleek, modern, with lots of subtle and not so subtle animations and interactions. The goal was to have everything feel well intentioned and smooth, without being over the top.

> Vanilla JS

> Vue.JS

> Front-end Lead

> In-browser Design

projects.title: Retail Compliance Center
projects.description:
# RILA Retail Compliance Center Matrix Application

This was an implementation of a new Matrix (filterable table) application for RCC. Their previous implementation was too visually busy, and difficult for the client to mange. The new application is built entirely in Vue.JS. The public facing view of this application is not too exciting, however as a content editor there is an admin-only view. Accessed through their CMS, once authenticated the content editor can add, remove, and drag and drop rows. The rows can also be edited via a modal popup editor. The editor is generated from a table schema JSON source (accessed from an API) that defines data types. This schema also defines the view of each data type. Rather than storing markup in the database for each cell, the application takes the data JSON, and builds out the view by referencing the schema. 


> Vue.JS

> API Generated Views

> Front-end Lead

> Back-end Integration
